author: by Julie Cook
title: It’s raining, it’s pouring but these fun days out aren’t boring
text:
Here’s a round-up of the 10 best indoor places in the South West to keep the whole family happy, even when the heavens open...
Bristol Aquarium See sharks, jellyfish, giant spider crabs and so much more at this amazing watery wonderland, which kids – and adults – will love. Nearest train station: Bristol Temple Meads.
Rex Bristol Aquarium
Quay Climbing Centre , Exeter Have your kids got pent-up energy? Get them to expend it here at the South West’s largest indoor climbing wall. Suitable for seasoned climbers, beginners and kids, this place also has an on-site cafe for a post-climb lunch! Nearest train station: Exeter St Thomas.
The Roman Baths, Bath This ancient wonder is a must for history buffs but also for kids who will marvel at the ancient fashions, old Roman coins and the entertaining guides who dress up in Roman clothes. Nearest train Station: Bath Spa.
The Eden Project, Bodelva, Cornwall Even if it’s bucketing down outside, you won’t care once you’re inside this jewel in Cornwall’s crown. See the famous domes which house the largest rainforest in captivity and have your little ones entranced by nature in all its beauty. Nearest train station: Luxulan or St Austell with bus services to the Eden Project.
PA The Eden Project
Oxford Ice Rink, Oxford If the rain’s made the streets slippery outside, why not slide about properly indoors at this great ice rink? Let the kids skate to their hearts’ content – join in, or simply watch from the sidelines whilst sipping a coffee. Nearest train Station: Oxford.
Museum of Somerset, Taunton, Somerset If any of your children is dinosaur-mad, this is the place to be. With an underfloor Plesiosaur, themed sessions and family fun days, you can give the kids a lesson in 400 million years of history and stay dry! Nearest train station: Taunton.
Cotswold Motoring Museum and Toy Collection, Bourton on the Water Kids (or parents) who love cars will be in their element here with vintage cars, classics and motorcycles. There’s also a toy collection that will have kids marveling and adults reminiscing. Nearest train station: Moreton-in-Marsh with bus services to Bourton.
National Museum Cardiff With free admission, this museum has a wealth of stuff going on from art collections, to dinosaur exhibitions to natural history. Kids will gasp at the 7.5 metre-long suspended Basking Shark! Nearest train station: Cardiff Central.
Rex Oxford Ice Rink
Grand Pier, Weston-super-Mare When it starts to rain, duck into the covered part of the pier and take the kids to the 4D cinema or indoor soft play Adventure Cove. If it brightens up, you can hit the beach again. But you’ll have trouble dragging the kids away! Nearest train station: Weston-super-Mare.
Wookey Hole Caves The whole family will marvel at how cavemen lived in these famous caves 50,000 years ago hunting bear and rhino. But that’s not all – there are also 20 other attractions including circus performances, indoor play centres and a mirror maze. You’ll be glad it rained! Plus, kids go free to Wookey Hole Caves with First Great Western. Nearest train station: Castle Cary – then 30 minutes by bus or taxi.
Visit www.firstgreatwestern.co.uk for all train information. Low train fares are available online in advance. Or try mTicketing – download the app and simply scan your ticket. Tickets subject to availability. Terms and conditions apply.
